ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.1.2_0: At that time Venerable Upananda the Sakyan was skilled at teaching.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.1.3_0: On one occasion the son of a prominent merchant approached Upananda,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.1.3_1: and after approaching and worshipping the Sakyan sat down on one side.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.1.4_0: And Upananda instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.1.5_0: Afterwards that merchant’s son said to Upananda:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.1.6_0: “Venerable, please tell me what you need.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.1.7_0: I’m able to give robes, almsfood, a dwelling, and medicines.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.1.8_0: the same thing to that merchant’s son,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.1.9_0: “It’s shameful for the son of a good family to walk around in only one wrap.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.1.10_0: Please wait until I get back home.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.1.11_0: has gone to your house or poured back or march back.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.1.13_0: the same thing to that merchant’s son,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.1.14_0: and he got the same reply.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.1.15_0: and a third time Upananda said
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.1.16_0: the same thing to that merchant’s son,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.1.17_0: and he got the same reply.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.1.18_0: They then said, “Why do you give an invitation if you don’t wish to give?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.1.19_0: Being pressured by Upananda, the merchant went to Upananda and gave him a bundle.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.2.1_0: People asked him, “Why are you walking around in only one wrap?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.2.2_0: He told them what had happened.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.2.3_0: People complained and criticized the monks,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.2.4_0: “These Sakyan ascetics have great desires; they are not content.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.2.5_0: Even to make them an appropriate offer isn’t easy.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.2.6_0: How can they take his wrap when the merchant’s son was making an appropriate offer?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.2.7_0: The monks heard the complaints of those people
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.2.8_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.2.9_0: “How can Venerable Upananda ask the merchant’s son for a robe?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.2.10_0: After rebuking him in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Upananda:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.2.11_0: “Is it true, Upananda, that you acted like this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.2.15_0: “Foolish man, people who are not related don’t know what’s appropriate and what’s inappropriate in dealing with each other, what’s right and what’s wrong.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.2.16_0: And still you asked the merchant’s son for a robe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.2.17_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.2.18_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.2.19.1_0: ‘If a monk asks an unrelated male or female householder for a robe, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:1.2.20_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:2.1_0: On one occasion a number of monks were traveling from Sāketa to Sāvatthī.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:2.1_1: As they were traveling, they were robbed to the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:2.2_0: Knowing that the Buddha had laid down this training rule and being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not ask for robes.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:2.3_0: They walked naked to Sāvatthī and bowed down to the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:2.4_0: The monks said to them, “Reverend Sundarīnandā, these monks are bowing down to them,”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:2.6_0: The monks said to Upāli, “Upāli, these are the directions.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:2.7_0: Upāli told them what had happened.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:2.7_1: Those monks then said to them, “They have been ejected for not recognizing an offense.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:2.8_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:2.10_0: Shouldn’t they have covered up with grass and leaves?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:2.11_0: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:2.12_0: After giving a teaching, the Buddha addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:2.13_0: “Monks, if a monk’s robes are stolen or destroyed, I allow him to ask an unrelated householder for robes.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:2.14_0: whatever monastery there is for the Sangha, if they go to a monastery or a the Sangha, we’ll make him sit down on a bed or seat with the upper robe.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:2.15_0: If there’s none of these things, he should cover up with grass and leaves before going on.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:2.15_1: But you should not go away.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:2.16_0: If he does, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:2.17_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:2.18.1_0: ‘If a monk asks an unrelated male or female householder for a robe, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:2.19_0: These are the appropriate occasions: his robes are stolen or his robes are destroyed.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:3.1.4_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:3.1.6_0: anyone who is not a descendant of one’s male ancestors going back seven generations, either on the mother’s side or on the father’s side.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:3.1.10_0: any woman who lives at home.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:3.1.12_0: one of the six kinds of robe-cloth, but not smaller than what can be transferred to another.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:3.1.13_0: Except if it is an appropriate occasion:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:3.1.14_0: unless it is an appropriate occasion.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:3.1.16_0: And a monk’s robe-cloth is robbed by kings or bandits, or any other scoundrels is liberated.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:3.1.18_0: a monk’s robe is burnt by fire, carried away by water, eaten by rats or termites, or worn through use.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:3.2.1_0: If he asks, except on an appropriate occasion, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:3.2.2_0: When he gets the robe-cloth, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:3.2.3_0: The blanket should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:3.2.4_0: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:3.2.6_0: ‘Venerables, this robe-cloth which I received after asking an unrelated householder for on an appropriate occasion, is to be relinquished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:3.2.7_0: I relinquish them to the Sangha.’ ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:3.2.10_0: ‘I give this robe-cloth back to you.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:3.3.1_0: If the person is unrelated and the monk perceives them as such, and he asks them for a robe-cloth, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:3.3.2_0: If the person is unrelated, but the monk is unsure of it, and he asks them for a robe-cloth, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:3.3.3_0: If the person is unrelated, but the monk perceives them as related, and he asks them for a robe-cloth, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:3.3.4_0: If the person is related, but the monk perceives them as unrelated, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:3.3.5_0: If the person is related, but the monk is unsure of it, commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:3.3.6_0: If the person is related and the monk perceives them as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:3.4.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:3.4.5_0: if it is built for someone else;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:3.4.6_0: if it is by means of her own property;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:3.4.8_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:3.4.9_0: The sixth rule, the training rule on asking non-relations, is finished.
